title: Analyzing the Line
text: Choose two points on the line. Then, count the rise and run, which are respectively the amount of $$y$$ units and the amount of $$x$$ units it changes from the point on the left to the point on the right. (Rise is positive if the line goes up and negative if it goes down.)

title: Slope Formula
text: The slope formula is $$\frac{rise}{run}$$. (Hint: Using the points as the hypotenuse of a small right triangle, count its rise and run. Rise is positive if the line goes up and negative if it goes down. Count the run from left to right, which will give you a positive value.)
